title: Better error messages for `grid_sample`
body_html:
Issue description

grid_sample yields irrelevant errors when passing wrong arguments

Code example

import torch

from torch.nn import functional as F

matrix = torch.randn(2, 3)
images = torch.rand(1, 3, 10, 10)

grid = F.affine_grid(matrix.float()[None], images.shape)

# ok: images_new = F.grid_sample(images, grid=grid)
# ok: images_new = F.grid_sample(images.to('cuda'), grid=grid.to('cuda'))

images_new = F.grid_sample(images, grid=grid.to('cuda')) 
images_new = F.grid_sample(images.to('cuda'), grid=grid)

First one:

FloatSpatialGridSamplerBilinear_updateOutput received an invalid combination of arguments - got (int, Tensor, Tensor, Tensor, int), but expected (int state, torch.FloatTensor input, torch.FloatTensor grid, torch.FloatTensor output, int padding_mode)

Second one:

RuntimeError: get_device is not implemented for type torch.FloatTensor

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: pytorch 0.4
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • OS: ubuntu16.04
  • PyTorch version: 0.4
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version:
  • GPU models and configuration: 1080
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):
  • CMake version:
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

body:
## Issue description

`grid_sample` yields irrelevant errors when passing wrong arguments
 


## Code example

```python
import torch

from torch.nn import functional as F

matrix = torch.randn(2, 3)
images = torch.rand(1, 3, 10, 10)

grid = F.affine_grid(matrix.float()[None], images.shape)

# ok: images_new = F.grid_sample(images, grid=grid)
# ok: images_new = F.grid_sample(images.to('cuda'), grid=grid.to('cuda'))

images_new = F.grid_sample(images, grid=grid.to('cuda')) 
images_new = F.grid_sample(images.to('cuda'), grid=grid) 

```

First one:
```
FloatSpatialGridSamplerBilinear_updateOutput received an invalid combination of arguments - got (int, Tensor, Tensor, Tensor, int), but expected (int state, torch.FloatTensor input, torch.FloatTensor grid, torch.FloatTensor output, int padding_mode)
```

Second one:
```
RuntimeError: get_device is not implemented for type torch.FloatTensor
```


## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: pytorch 0.4
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
- OS: ubuntu16.04
- PyTorch version: 0.4
- Python version: 3.6
- CUDA/cuDNN version:
- GPU models and configuration: 1080
- GCC version (if compiling from source):
